title.value: Dosimetry of [18F]TRACK, the first PET tracer for imaging of TrkB/C receptors in humans
title.justification: The title of the paper extracted from the given text
title.quote: Dosimetry of [18F]TRACK, the first PET tracer for imaging of TrkB/C receptors in humans

extractions.description: This research paper presents dosimetry data for [18F]TRACK, the first PET radioligand for TrkB/C, in healthy humans, highlighting its biodistribution, organ-specific doses, and total effective dose.

type.justification: The paper involves the collection and analysis of dosimetry data for the [18F]TRACK radiotracer in human subjects, which is characteristic of empirical research.
type.quote: Here we report dosimetry data for [18F]TRACK in healthy humans.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on the usage of PET imaging to study the TrkB/C receptors in humans.
name.quote: [18F]TRACK is the first PET radioligand for TrkB/C with proven in vivo brain penetration and on-target specific signal.

name.justification: The study involves radiological methods related to PET/CT imaging and dosimetry of the radiotracer.
name.quote: 6 healthy participants (age 22–61 y, 3 female) were scanned on a General Electric Discovery PET/CT 690 scanner.

name.justification: The paper focuses on imaging TrkB/C receptors, which are relevant in the context of neurological conditions like Alzheimer's disease.
name.quote: Reduced expression or abnormal and impaired signalling of Trk receptors are found in a vast spectrum of disorders and pathologies, such as ischemic stroke, Alzheimer’s disease (AD) and others.

name.justification: The use of PET tracers and radioligands indicates that the study is also related to the field of Nuclear Medicine.
name.quote: Dosimetry of [18F]TRACK, the first PET tracer for imaging of TrkB/C receptors in humans

name.justification: [18F]TRACK is the main subject of study as a PET radioligand for imaging TrkB/C receptors.
name.quote: [18F]TRACK is the first PET radioligand for TrkB/C with proven in vivo brain penetration and on-target specific signal.

is_contributed.justification: The paper presents original research and dosimetry data on [18F]TRACK, thus contributing this model to the field.
is_contributed.quote: We developed [18F]TRACK, an 18F-derivative of [11C]-(R)-IPMICF16, displaying significantly reduced P-gp-liability, brain off-target selectivity, and favorably adjusted binding affinity in TrkB/C rich regions.

is_executed.justification: The study does not mention any specific use of GPU or CPU for executing [18F]TRACK, as the focus is on PET imaging and radiotracer distribution.
is_executed.quote: [18F]TRACK was synthesized with high molar activities (Am = 250 ± 75 GBq/µmol)...

is_compared.justification: The study does not compare [18F]TRACK numerically with other models but rather focuses on its dosimetry and biodistribution.
is_compared.quote: The objective of this study was to provide dosimetry data for [18F]TRACK in humans.

referenced_paper_title.value: First-in-human brain imaging of [18F]TRACK, a PET tracer for tropomyosin receptor kinases
referenced_paper_title.justification: This referenced paper appears to be an earlier study related to the initial human brain imaging of [18F]TRACK.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Bailey JJ, Kaiser L, Lindner S, Wust M, Thiel A, Soucy JP, et al. First-in-human brain imaging of [(18)F]TRACK, a PET tracer for tropomyosin receptor kinases.
